meanings.definition: To regain possession or control of (something lost or taken away)
meanings.sent1: After searching for days, she finally reattained her lost necklace.
meanings.sent2: He reattained his stolen bike by finding it in the park.
meanings.sent3: The cat reattained its favorite toy after it was hidden under the couch.
meanings.sent4: With determination, she reattained her position as the team captain.
meanings.sent5: The sun reattained its place in the sky after the storm passed.

meanings.definition: To achieve or reach (a certain level or status) again
meanings.sent1: Despite the setback, he managed to reattain his previous high score in the game.
meanings.sent2: She worked hard to reattain her fitness level after taking a break from exercise.
meanings.sent3: The plant reattained its full height after being pruned back.
meanings.sent4: After a period of struggle, he reattained his former glory in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The athlete reattained his speed and agility through rigorous training.
